originalTitle: Kenya's border with Somalia set to re-open after almost 15 years
title: Kenya's border with Somalia set to re-open after almost 15 years
content: Somali Islamist militant group al-Shabab has staged several attacks in Kenya, prompting the border to be closed.

originalTitle: Port city in ruins as storm rips through Madagascar and on towards Mozambique
title: Port city in ruins as storm rips through Madagascar and on towards Mozambique
content: More than half the population is affected and most infrastructure destroyed in Toamasina, Madagascar's main port.

originalTitle: At least 21 dead after boat sinks on Sudan's River Nile
title: Helpers on the Big River: Sad News in Sudan
content:
Hello from Africa!

Hi everyone! It's your friendly reporter here, bringing you news from our amazing continent, Africa. Today, we have some very important news to share from a country called Sudan. Sometimes, news can be a little bit sad, but it's important to learn about what's happening and how people help each other. We always want to share stories about how people are kind and brave, especially when things are tough.

Where is Sudan?

Imagine a big map of Africa. Sudan is a lovely country that you would find in the northeastern part of Africa. It's a place with lots of sunshine, some big deserts, and very friendly people. Sudan is also famous because a super-duper long river flows right through it! This river is like a highway for water, and it helps many people in Sudan with their farms and getting around. It’s a very important part of life there. Did you know? Sudan is one of the biggest countries in Africa! It has a very rich history with ancient pyramids, just like Egypt.

The Mighty River Nile

The river we are talking about is called the River Nile. It's not just any river; it's one of the longest rivers in the whole wide world! Imagine a river so long that it travels through many different countries before it finally reaches the big blue sea. The Nile River is like a lifeline for Sudan, bringing water for drinking, for growing food, and for travel. Many towns and villages are built right next to the Nile because it is so important. Did you know? The River Nile is so long, it travels through 11 different countries in Africa! That's a lot of places for one river to visit!

What Happened on the River?

Sadly, something very sad happened on the River Nile in Sudan recently. A boat was traveling, carrying many people, including grown-ups and children. Boats are often used there, just like we use cars or buses, to go from one place to another across the water. But this boat had an accident and it sank into the water. This made everyone very, very worried and sad. When the boat sank, many people were in the water. Some people were able to get out and were safe, but sadly, some grown-ups and children did not make it. And some people are still missing. This means that grown-ups are looking everywhere for them, hoping to find them. It's a very difficult time for the families and friends of those on the boat.

Heroes Helping Out

Even though this is a sad story, there are always heroes in tough times. Right now, there are so many brave people working very hard to help. These heroes are rescue workers, police officers, and even regular people who live nearby. They are using their own boats to search the river. They are looking for anyone who is still missing, and they are also helping those who were rescued and need comfort and care. These helpers are working day and night. They are looking in the water and along the river banks. They want to make sure everyone is found. When something sad like this happens, it shows us how people come together to support each other. Everyone is trying their best to help the families who are hurting. Did you know? Rescue workers often train for many years to learn how to save people in difficult situations, like in water accidents or during floods!

Why Do People Use Boats?

In places like Sudan, rivers are like big roads. For many people, especially those living near the River Nile, using a boat is the easiest and sometimes the only way to travel. Boats help people go to school, visit family in another village, or take things to sell at the market. So, boats are a very important part of daily life for many communities. They connect people and places. But just like cars need to be safe on the road, boats need to be safe on the water. It's important that boats are not too full and that everyone on board knows how to stay safe.

Learning About Boat Safety

This sad news reminds us all about how important it is to be safe around water and on boats. If you ever go on a boat, whether it's on a river or a big lake, there are some very important rules to remember: 1. **Wear a life jacket!** This is like a special vest that helps you float in the water if you fall in. It's super important! 2. **Don't stand up or run around in a boat.** It can make the boat wobble and might make it tip over. 3. **Listen to the grown-up in charge of the boat.** They know the rules and how to keep everyone safe. 4. **Don't put too many people in one boat.** Boats have a limit on how many people they can carry safely. These rules help keep everyone safe and happy when they are enjoying the water. Grown-ups who own boats need to make sure their boats are in good shape and follow all the safety rules. Did you know? Life jackets are usually bright colors like orange or yellow so that if someone falls into the water, they can be easily spotted!

Big Hearts in Sudan

When sad things happen, people in Sudan show how much they care for each other. Families, friends, and even people who don't know the families directly are coming together. They are sharing food, offering comfort, and praying for those who are missing and for the families who are grieving. This is called community spirit, and it means everyone helps each other like a big family. It reminds us that even when bad things happen, there is always kindness and love in the world. Everyone is working together to bring comfort and help to the people affected by this accident.

Keeping Hope Alive

The search for the missing people is still going on. We are sending our biggest thoughts and hopes to all the families in Sudan. We hope that the heroes searching the river find everyone. This event reminds us how precious life is and why it's so important to always be careful and kind to each other. We will keep listening for more news and hoping for the best outcomes for everyone involved. Stay safe, everyone!
summary: A sad boat accident happened on the big River Nile in Sudan, where rescue teams are working hard to find missing people, including children, and everyone is learning about boat safety.
whyMatters: This news is important because it teaches us about staying safe when we travel on boats, how communities help each other in difficult times, and how special and powerful big rivers like the Nile are for people in Africa.

title: Norway's former PM charged with gross corruption over Epstein links
content: The charge was brought after the Council of Europe lifted his immunity, which he had as its former secretary general.

originalTitle: Tuchel deal delights FA - but timing has echoes of Capello decision
title: Tuchel deal delights FA - but timing has echoes of Capello decision
content: The FA is celebrating England head coach Thomas Tuchel's new deal as a coup - but the timing revives memories of its Fabio Capello blunder, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

title: Nottingham Forest close in on Pereira appointment

title: Sterling joins Feyenoord until end of season
